intro: Hemitelia microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved hemitelia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tubular, two-lipped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
